text: Scarpetta is a novel by Patricia Cornwell. It was published in 2008 by G. P. Putnam's Sons. The book is a continuation of Cornwell's popular Kay Scarpetta series. ==Synopsis== Dr. Kay Scarpetta is called in to examine a Bellevue Hospital patient in New York City. The patient, Oscar Bane, tells Scarpetta that he has been framed for a murder he did not commit by somebody who is stalking him. ==External links== *USA Today profile of Scarpetta Category:2008 American novels Category:Novels by Patricia Cornwell Category:Novels set in New York City Category:American crime novels Category:G.
